title: Login
name: Login
description: If valid login credentials are provided, a user object, containing an authentication token, will be returned. If the user has the restaurateur roleID, the response body will also contain restaurant and menu objects.

Parameter.description: The email address which is associated to the user's Waitr account
The user's password

examples.title: Success-Response (200):

groupDescription: Used by clients to retrieve an access token for users, which will be provided in all requests thereafter

title: Create
name: Create
description: A user may add a new category to an existing menu.

Parameter.description: The ID of the menu to which the category is to be added
The category name, e.g. "Desserts"
A string describing the category

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Category resource

title: Update
name: Update
description: The details of a category may be updated by the user.

Parameter.description: The ID of the category to be updated
A new name for the category, e.g. "Puddings"
A new description for the category
This parameter can be used to activate or deactivate a category (only active categories will be visible to customers).

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Category resource

title: Create
name: Create
description: A user may add a new item to an existing menu category.

Parameter.description: The ID of the category to which the item is to be added
The item name, e.g. "BBQ Ribs"
The price of the item, to two decimal places
A string describing the item

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Item resource

title: Update
name: Update
description: The details of an item may be updated by the user.

Parameter.description: The ID of the item to be updated
A new name for the item, e.g. "BBQ Pork Ribs"
The new price of the item, to two decimal places
A new description for the item
This parameter can be used to activate or deactivate an item (only active items will be visible to customers).

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Item resource

title: Create
name: Create
description: A user can add a new menu to an existing restaurant.

Parameter.description: The ID of the restaurant to which the menu is to be assigned
The name of the menu, e.g. "Main Menu"
A description of the menu, e.g. "Our delicious main courses"

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Menu resource

title: Get
name: Get
description: A user can retrieve a menu, including all its categories and items.

Parameter.description: The ID of the menu to be retrieved

examples.title: Success-Response (200):

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Menu resource

title: Update
name: Update
description: A user can add a new menu to an existing restaurant.

Parameter.description: The ID of the menu to be updated
A new name for the menu, e.g. "Mains"
A new description of the menu, e.g. "A variety of our delicious main courses"
This parameter can be used to deactivate the menu (only active menus are visible to customers). If this parameter is provided, all other optional parameters will be ignored.

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Menu resource

title: Get
name: Get
description: A user can retrieve a specific order. Useful when a customer wishes to see a breakdown of an order they've placed.

Parameter.description: The ID of the order to be retrieved

examples.title: Success-Response (200):

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Order resource

title: List
name: List
description: A user can retrieve a list of orders; either all orders placed by a particular diner, or all those placed at a particular restaurant.

Parameter.description: The ID of the owner of the orders. For a diner's orders, provide a valid userId. For a restaurant's orders, provide a valid restaurantId.
Setting this parameter to true will cause the server to filter out any resolved orders (e.g. accepted orders, rejected orders etc.). Defaults to false.

examples.title: Success-Response (200):

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Order resource

title: Refund
name: Refund
description: A restaurant can refund an existing paid-for order. The server calls the Stripe API to reverse the charge.

Parameter.description: The ID of the order to be refunded

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Order resource

title: Create
name: Create
description: A user can create - and assign to himself - a new restaurant.

Parameter.description: The ID of the user to whom the restaurant is to be assigned
The name of the restaurant, e.g. "Fellsville Tandoori"
A string describing the restaurant, e.g. "Fellsville's favourite Indian restaurant"
The name of the town in which the restaurant is based
The restaurant's contact email address
The restaurant's contact number

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Restaurant resource

title: Get
name: Get
description: A user can retrieve a particular restaurant.

Parameter.description: The ID of the restaurant to be retrieved

examples.title: Success-Response (200):

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Restaurant resource

title: List
name: List
description: A user can retrieve a complete list of Waitr's active restaurants.

examples.title: Success-Response (200):

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Restaurant resource

title: Get
name: List
description: A restaurant can retrieve an up-to-date breakdown of which of their tables are occupied by active customers.

Parameter.description: The ID of the restaurant whose up-to-date table breakdown is to be retrieved

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Restaurant resource

title: Update
name: Update
description: A user can update the details of an existing restaurant.

Parameter.description: The new name of the restaurant, e.g. "Fellsville Best Tandoori"
A string describing the restaurant, e.g. "Fellsville's favourite Indian cuisine"
The name of the town in which the restaurant is based
The restaurant's contact email address
The restaurant's contact number
This parameter can be used to activate or deactivate a restaurant (only active restaurants are visible to customers).

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Restaurant resource

title: UpdateStripeAccount
name: UpdateStripeAccount
description: A user can update the stripe-account details of an existing restaurant. This endpoint can also be used to initially create the restaurant's Stripe account.

Parameter.description: The ID of the restaurant whose Stripe acccount is to be updated/created
The type of Stripe account that is to be created. Must be 'custom'
The country to which the Stripe account will be associated. Must be the two-letter country code 'GB'
The email address to be assigned to the Stripe account
A bank account in tokenised form, provided by the Stripe API. It is the responsiblity of the client to first call Stripe's API to retrieve a toke.

A stringified object detailing the restaurateur's acceptance of Stripe's terms-of-services agreement. Refer to Stripe's docs for info about specific properties: https://stripe.com/docs/connect/required-verification-information
An stringified object detailing such things as the restaurant's owner. Refer to Stripe's docs for info about specific properties: https://stripe.com/docs/connect/required-verification-information

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the Restaurant resource

title: Create
name: Create
description: Handles the creation of a new user account.

Parameter.description: The type of user account to be created. Can be either "diner" or "restaurateur"
The user's first name
The user's surname (family name)
A valid email address to be assigned to the user's Waitr account
A string containing a minimum of eight characters, at least one letter, and at least one number.
If the type parameter is "restaurateur", this parameter must be provided. Otherwise it will be ignored.

examples.title: Success-Response (201):

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the User resource

title: Update
name: Update
description: Handles the modification of the details of an existing user account.

Parameter.description: The ID of the user to be updated
The user's new first name
The user's new surname (family name)
A new valid email address to be assigned to the user's Waitr account. (If this parameter is provided, all other optional parameters will be ignored.)
A string containing a minimum of eight characters, at least one letter, and at least one number. (If this parameter is provided, all other optional parameters will be ignored.)
A string containing a minimum of eight characters, at least one letter, and at least one number.

groupDescription: All endpoints relating to the User resource
